reviewText: Like many others, I loved Knots Landing when it was on the air, and I still love it today. I kept all the episodes on my old VHS tapes, but when the first season was available on DVD, I bought it without any hesitation. I will buy all seasons if Warner decides to release them.To this day, I still consider Knots the best nighttime soap. I watched all of them, Dallas, Dynasty, Falcon Crest, etc and I will continue to support those series when the become available on DVDs. I already bought the first 9 seasons of Dallas, and the 3 of Dynasty.Regarding KNOTS LANDING, I believe the show became much better after the 4th season, so I wish Warner would release the seasons more quickly!I want to say I really appreciate that the French subtitles are offered on the DVDs of Knots. Those subtitles were also available on the first seasons of Dallas, but not later on.Knots Landing being available on DVD will give a chance to new people to discover the series. Desperate Housewives is a huge success now and I'm sure that all the fans will appreciate Knots as well.So if you are a old fan of Knots, show your support by buying the DVD sets, and if you want to become a new fan, just do the same !KNOTS LANDING FOREVER !!!
summary: I want all the seasons of Knots Landing !

reviewText: I agree with the previous reviewers on most points. Abby definately made Knots Landing more interesting to watch. Donna Mills did for Knots what Joan Collins did for Dynasty....to a degree. It was more a combination of Abby's scheming and the writing improving. I disagree with the fact that most reviewers are writing that Knots did not become good until its fourth or fifth season. This is not true. Knots starting improving in both its storylines and its ratings in season 3.(I wonder if Don Murray was kicking himself when Knots Landing hit its stride only after he left. I seriously doubt he left Knots to guest star on The Facts of Life.)Spoiler alert!! I began watching Knots Landing toward the end of the third season when Abby and Gary were having their affair. I still remember the priceless looks on all three four faces, Gary, Abby, Karen and especially Val's when she(Val) walked into the apartment and caught Gary and Abby in bed together. From that moment I was hooked and could not wait until the next fall to see what was going to happen next.Like the others, I do agree that everyone should purchase Season 2 so that more seasons will be released. Knots Landing is an American staple that deserves to have the complete dvd treatment!!

reviewText: The 1979-80 TV season was followed by a strike that led to the following season beginning late.  Warner Brothers thoughtfully has given us a taste of what that experience must have felt like for viewers back in 1980 - and maximized it - by making us wait three entire years between the first and second seasons of "Knots Landing" on DVD.  Thanks, WB!  Never mind that for many devoted "Knots" viewers, the first season is only a prologue to the actual show, a thirteen-episode intro that sets up all the characters.  Season Two is when the real fun begins and that's largely because of Abby.  But it's not because Abby rules alone;  it's because she meshes so well with the other characters.  Suddenly, the show springs to life.Why does Abby bring so much to the show?  Because she's not pure malice like JR and she's not an over-the-top vamp like Alexis.  Abby is well-written and rather than being a real villain, she just happens to be one of the heroes of the show who does her own thing.  After a peaceful beginning in the early episodes of Season Two, we get down to the rivalry that defines the show for years: Karen vs. Abby.  Sure, Abby eventually causes trouble in Val's marriage but it's Abby's relationship with Karen that's central. It's so much fun to watch it start from the hug Karen gives Abby when she first arrives at Seaview Circle to the fast deterioration of their friendship.But that's just part of the joys that await us in Season Two.  We get the first signs of trouble in Gary and Val's marriage, a crossover visit from "Dallas" Kristen Shepard, Sid being convicted of attempted rape, the continuing dysfunction that is the Avery marriage.  And then there' Kenny and Ginger.This season does end in a rather intense cliffhanger and I can only hope that Warner Brothers doesn't make us wait three more years.  Come on, "Dallas" is more than 75% released and we're only on Season Two of "Knots"?  Please buy this so we can get the entire series.  There's so much more ahead - baby nappings, kidnappings, lookialike singers and Alec Baldwin- and it would be a shame to miss any of it.
summary: Finally, a little more suburban strife
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Knots Landing: Season 2" (1980-81) has finally made it's way to DVD and I'm sure a lot of you fans will join me in saying to the studios "it's about time!!" This season features the debut of '80's Prime-Time Soap Queen, Donna Mills and introduces a variety of characters and some great storylines to follow in the seasons to come!  Here is a look at the 18 episodes in Season 2:1- Hitchhike (Part 1)Sid picks up a young hitchhiker who sets him up by asking him to give her money. When he refuses, she accuses him of rape. Diana has difficulty facing people. Sid's sister, Abby Cunningham, (Donna Mills) arrives in Knots Landing with her two children. Karen persuades Sid to find a new attorney instead of Richard.2- Hitchhike (Part 2)After Sid fires Richard as the attorney, Richard, in a drunken stupor, causes a scene in the cul-de-sac. Karen is angry when she discovers Richard tried to pay off the hitchhiker to drop the charges. Karen remembers a vital clue which results in getting Sid cleared. Abby decides to move to Knots Landing, and becomes a part of prime-time soap history!3- Remember The Good TimesGary meets Judy Trent who wants his help in getting her husband support from AA. Abby begins to show her manipulative nature (Already?  ) as she takes advantage of Eric and treis to seduce Kenny. Karen confronts her about this.4- Chance of a LifetimeGary makes a car deal with "Orchid Cab Co." againest Sid's better judgment. Gary also hires a female mechanic, Linda Stryker. Laura starts her real estate job. After her first sale, her boss, Scooter Warren, kisses her.Val starts college. Richard thinks a prestigious Chicago law firm will hire him, so he tells off his boss and quits his job. Then he finds out the Chicago firm's offer is for a salary several thousands less than he was already making. He cannot accept the job. He tells Laura he declined the job since she didn't want to move, but then starts crying.5- KristinKristin Shepard is in Los Angeles following the shooting of J.R. in Dallas. After being arrested at a party for drug use, she calls Gary and Val for help and manipulates Val into letting her stay with the Ewings, but ends up causing trouble in the cul-de-sac. Kenny ends his relationship with Sylvie and tries to reconcile with Ginger, but his involvement with Kristin poses a problem.6- Step OneDiana is having difficulty with her new boyfriend as she feels a pressure to sleep with him. Karen, Diana, Val and Ginger are performing in an ERA benefit. Val asks Gary to help, but he's too preoccupied helping Earl Trent. Diana needs Karen's support but she is too busy rehearsing. In frustration, Diana pulls out of the ERA. Meanwhile with Laura preoccupied with work, Richard spends his time with Abby and they end up in the hot tub. Karen and Diana make up and sing, "Put on a Happy Face".7- Breach of FaithThe neighbors throw a barbecue for Laura to celebrate her new success as a realtor. At the party, Richard paws Abby and Laura overhears them planning to meet later. Laura later tells Richard she will no longer be his "whipping boy", and if his behavior continues, she is going to leave him. Ginger finds out she is pregnant and breaks up with Carl. Val is upset because Gary runs every time Judy Trent needs help with Earl. Val says she needs time with Gary too. Gary continues to comfort Judy and begins an affair with her.8- ScapegoatsThe Fairgates find out that Michael suffers from ADHD (Attention Deficit Hyperactive Disorder). Sid hires Abby as the bookkeeper for Knots Landing Motors. Frank Kolbert and Roy Lance from "Orchid Cab Co" offer Gary a deal on cheap parts, but Sid declines, thinking it sounds illegal. Frank and Roy tell Gary they had a verbal agreement and threaten him, telling him he'd better have $50,000.00 for them by the end of the week. Abby overhears and suggests Gary ask J.R. for the money, as she read in the paper that J.R. will be in town soon.9- A Family MatterJ.R. Ewing is in town for an oil convention. When Gary refuses to ask him for the money, Abby goes to J.R. for it and sleeps with him. J.R. says he knows that Abby has designs on Gary and that he'll only give Gary the money if he asks for it himself, so Abby keeps trying to persuade Gary. Val asks Gary not to get in any deals with J.R., and she and J.R. have a nasty confrontation. Roy and Frank continue to pressure Gary, so he finally goes to J.R., who gives him the $50,000.00. Kenny breaks up with Sylvie and wants to get back with Ginger, but she says no.10- ChoicesLinda asks Sid to go away to a race for the weekend. Sid decides not to go, but doesn't pick up on the fact that Linda's interested in him romantically. Gary sells the illegal parts to Sid's supplier so that Sid won't know about it. Laura tries to initiate romance with Richard, but he rejects her. Meanwhile, Abby has started to reject him. Abby and Judy argue over who will 'get' Gary. Judy tells Val that she and Gary are having an affair and love each other. Gary finds Val at the beach. She slaps Gary but they make up. Judy comes to KLMotors the next day. Gary's mad that she told Val, and says he will never leave Val. Judy leaves, and Abby says "Are you ready for ME now Gary?"11- A State of MindJeff Cunningham is mad that Abby is having an affair with a married man (Richard) in front of the kids. Sid hears Karen talking with Jeff, and tells her not to discuss Abby with him. Karen says that Sid is blind to Abby, but he defends her and they argue. Jeff files for custody of the kids. He and Abby talk, and he admits he wants her back. Abby sleeps with him so he'll drop the case, and then tells him that it was a one-time thing. Jeff is angry and says she's not playing 'fair' with him. One of Laura's clients kisses her, but she says she can't cheat on Richard. Abby tells Richard that it's over between them.12- PlayersRichard gets a job with Kippler, Janson and Stern. He apologizes to Laura for how he's been treating her, but secretly is upset that she earns more than he does. Ginger finally tells Kenny that she's pregnant, but that they need to work out their problems before he can move back in. Karen is upset that Linda is in love with Sid, and is scared that they might be having an affair. Sid and Linda take a test drive and the car breaks down on a deserted desert road. Linda tells Sid she loves him. They kiss, but he says he can't have an affair with her. Sid tells Karen he didn't have an affair with Linda, but jokes that if he had he wouldn't tell her, because he hates to 'brag'. Karen is not amused.13- The Loudest WordKenny goes to see Ginger at school and implores her to get back together with him. She still refuses. Kenny shows up at her Lamaze class and they argue. Ginger feels bad, and finally tells him that both she and the baby need him. Val's doctor finds a malignant growth in her colon and needs to operate. Gary can't handle it - he feels so guilty about how he's treated Val, and totally breaks down. He calls Miss Ellie weeping, so Bobby comes to support him while Val's in the hospital. The doctor is able to remove all of the cancer.14- Moments of TruthThe men take Kenny out to celebrate and the women give Ginger a baby shower at Val's house. Three criminals break into the house to rob the women. Diana, in the kitchen, escapes and calls police. The robbers then take the women hostage. A swat team is called. Tempers flare among the men, who are feeling helpless. After 8 hours, the swat team apprehends the robbers and everybody is okay.15- Man of the HourJeff picks up the kids and Abby is afraid he has kidnapped them when she can't locate them. Jeff finally returns them and says they were camping. Ginger's sister Cindy visits, and gives Eric marijuana to hold for her. Sid finds it and is very upset. At a party, Cindy freaks out and runs into the ocean. Eric saves her, but she's in a coma. The doctor says the pot had angel dust in it. Eric is upset as everyone blames him, thinking it's his pot. Cindy finally wakes up, and tells everyone that it wasn't Eric's pot.16- More Than FriendsAbby comes on to Gary, but then says she's kidding when she sees how uncomfortable he is. Everyone thinks Laura's having an affair with Scooter, because of all their flirting. Laura tells Scooter that they can't really have an affair, because they're both married. Richard asks Laura if she'd like to discuss his affair with Abby, so that they can start over. Val's night school teacher is Earl Trent. He invites Val over to work on a story, and then asks her to sleep with him to get even with Gary and Judy. Val refuses and he starts to force her, but then breaks down weeping. Gary comes over and apologizes to Earl for having an affair with his wife.17- DesignsJ.R. comes to town (again). He wants to form a corporation with Sid and patent the engine that Sid invented. Sid refuses. Abby steals the engine plans and gives them to J.R., and has him sign a contract to protect her interests. They sleep together. Karen tells Sid that Abby stole the plans, but he doesn't believe her. Karen and Val are suspicious when Jeff comes to pick up the kids, and packs all of their things into his van. Karen goes to J.R.'s hotel to tell Abby she thinks Jeff kidnapped the kids, but Abby doesn't believe her and says Jeff is just trying to scare her again.18- SqueezeplayJeff doesn't return the kids and Abby's really worried. The FBI question Gary about Frank and Roy, and Gary finally admits his illegal dealings to Sid. Abby claims to be innocent, and Sid believe her. Gary and Sid agree to do a sting operation for the FBI, and Frank and Roy are arrested. Sid and Gary will have to testify, so the FBI guards them. One of the mechanics at KLMotors lets the brake fluid out of Sid's car. Abby receives a tape from Jeff telling her he took the kids because she is a bad mother. Abby totally flips out, so Karen calls Sid to come home to help Abby. Sid and an FBI agent get in his car to drive home. As they drive around the road, Sid realizes the breaks won't work. The car goes out of control crashes over the side of an embankment down to the beach below.

reviewText: See the notify link at the top right of this page?  The one where Amazon notifies you when this season is to be released?  Maybe if enough of us use it, it'll convince Warner Brothers to finally follow through.  C'mon, it only takes a minute, but if you're not logged on at Amazon at the moment it might take a little bit longer.  Just do it...I agree, Season 1 was shorter than I would've liked--only 13 episodes, which makes sense as KL didn't start until late December.  Warner Brothers might want to do what was done with Dynasty: Dynasty, too almost didn't see 2nd come out for the same reason but when it finally did, both 1 and 2 were bundled together.  I'd offer KL 1 and 2 together once 2nd's finally available, or 2nd alone if so desired.I gave this one only 1 star because we're still waiting for it.Update, finally: I see I'm late in updating my review for this product.  Originally I gave this product 1 star but now it's all 5 stars.  I bought this set at a store and enjoyed this season.  S1 was CC only, no subtitles available.  S2 is not CC but available with English subtitles.  At least deaf or hard of hearing viewers can still understand the dialogues.  18 episodes here and it's interesting how the season wrapped up considering the series would go on to draw more viewers in the subsequent seasons.Here's hoping for Season 3!
summary: Maybe if we do this, 2nd will finally turn up..update: thank you for 2nd!

reviewText: Like all/most great shows, Knots Landing started to hit its stride a bit past the first season.  I have little doubt that sales of Season Two would increase for one reason:  Donna Mills.  She walked the line between vicious and just-not-heartless enough to keep us loving and hating her for years.  Abby's clashes with Karen and Val were legendary, though her first target was the ever-tenuous Avery marriage.  Bigger Knots fanatics than I (me?) are researching this...I just needed to add my name to the growing list of those waiting.  And as always, please e-mail me Constance McCashin, by clicking my name above.  I hope you're doing well!
summary: At least there's a link for it.  Must be released soon...Donna Mills included!

reviewText: I've been a patient consumer and waited for Knot's Landing to be rolled out season-by-season like Dallas. I bought KL 1 and KL 2. And where's 3? No announcement. No plans for releasing more seasons of this classic show. For whatever reason, the addle-brained producers would rather sit on the old tapes than earn money from DVD sales. There are places online to buy the ENTIRE SERIES on bootleg DVDs, usually snagged from over the air broadcasts abroad. That's what I'm going to do. You can get all of "Falcon Crest," too. You can even find little gems like "The Homefront." Google "knots landing complete DVD." The quality may not be as good as digitally remastered DVDs, but if it's a choice between lesser quality and nothing, I'll take the lesser quality.

reviewText: I , like most people who have ordered, watched and written about "Knots Landing" was  a great fan of the series back in the day (and thats saying something as "Dallas" and "Knots" were 'It' as far as soaps went for me and my tastes in recent years has been very "Sopranos", "Six Feet under", "Mad Men" oriented)It was a flavoursome piece of nonsense with some great actors and a lot of fun, especially the last few episodes before it ended."Desperate Housewives" is boring cliche in comparison.BUt these early episodes are hard to watch. Obviously the reason the initial release of the series did so badly is, as with season 2 (despite the definite improvement of Donna Mills doing dirty deeds so delicously)its all just so dated.From memory the series didnt start to hit its mark till about half way through season 3 and then blossomed in Season 4 when they split up Gary and Val and it became a serial instead of these self contained episodes. The episodic nature of the early series is so so dated, the look of the actors is hilariously bad (Michelle Lee looks anorexic and the hair looks like a clump of horse hair stuck to her head) How these actors must cringe when they see themselves back then. !!!My point is that for the series to succeed on DVD , Warners need to release the first three seasons very quickly to get it into the meat and potatoes of the series when it took off in the ratings from season 1982-83 onwards.If I remember rightly the series was almost cancelled several times in the early days which was why they kept plonking Larry Hagman, Patrick Duffy et al into the series(dont know where they ever found the time). So lets get season 3 out of the way quickly and release season 4 when the series really did take off. Lets not fool ourselves, these first few seasons are beyond awful (though the prints dont worry me as much as it seems to worry everyone else)and the characters of "Kenny' and "Ginger"when did they leave? yuk yuk yuk. !!!!The quicker the better.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Like many Knots fans here, I would rather buy ligit box sets of Knots Landing than bootleg versions out there of all 14 seasons. The packaging of season 1 would not have helped Warners get their sales target....too soft....not 'retail' looking enough....As season 1 coincided with the release of Dallas seasons 1 & 2 dvd set, I would have packaged Knots Landing seasons 1 & 2 together also to kick start on going box set releases and had pics of Larry Hagman (who guest starred) and Donna Mills (season 2's main drawcard) on the Knots Landing dvd covers as well as pics of some of the main characters. Dallas season box sets have obviously taken off as they are currently up to Season 11. If I was a key decision maker at Warners for dvd releases, I'd reboot and re-release Knots Landing seasons 1 & 2 together, throw in some good interviews, a TV special or 2 and redo the packaging with a more dynamic design with cross over characters from Dallas for more customer appeal and call it special edition/limited edition. Then it would walk off the shelves. Once customers have watched season 2, they will be hooked to buy remaining seasons. Future box sets should be released 2 seasons at a time to catch up with and compete with Dallas and Dynasty season box set sales.
summary: Brilliant show but wrong marketing approach by Warners

reviewText: I can't help but wonder why Warner didn't release Seasons 1 and 2 together? I wouldn't have minded that; I'd buy all season sets of it anyway. Season 1 is a (comparatively) different, simpler show than what Knots Landing would eventually mature into. I for one remember, as an early teen, sneaking into the lounge room of a Saturday night (I think it screened here, Down Under, at something like 11.30 pm which is ungodly programming by Oz standards!) to get my Knots Landing fix. Pure trashy and flashy, Knots Landing was and still is great TV! So hurry up WB and get the rest of the series on DVD!

reviewText: I was only a kid when this season aired in 1980, but even then, I was always fascinated with these characters, maybe because me & my family lived in a similar setting, no our neighborhood homes didn't have all the perks that these CA homes had, but it was close, I won't summarize the season because most reviewers here already have, my review is about the quality of the show, to the reviewer that said that Warner Bros. didn't clean up the print>>> you need to adjust your color settings, on my T.V. the colors are just as they should be & I don't even have a widescreen T.V. (yet), the fleshtones are right, it is not faded as one reviewer stated, for a show that was filmed in 1980, this print is awesome, the colors jump out at you, more than it did in Season 1, & for the one that disliked Kenny & Ginger, I don't know about you, but to me Ginger was the prettiest one on the block, I quit watching when they were written out, overall Warner Bros. has done a good job with this release, please don't be put off by the negative reviews!
summary: Awesome show, hope Season 3 isn't far off!!!

reviewText: Well, this has taken some time! "Knots" fans are well known to be be the most loyal and and caring fans on the planet.Years ago, I had the VHS versions from Columbia House, and quite abruptly they stopped.Okay...Then SoapNet did re-runs of our show... also stopped!YIKES!Season One came out on DVD, and we had to wait.  AND WAIT.I am delighted that season 2 will be available soon.  Donna/Abby turns up in season 2,and it is interesting to see how her part evolve's. Heartbreak for Karen and Val!Knots was shot at what is now Sony Pictures Hollywood, along with the power-house DALLAS, the beloved FALCON CREST and NBC's under-apreciated FLAMINGO ROAD.  All from LORIMAR.Knot's was always the 'regular person' show - Seaview Circle was a place for real ( well, semi-real) people had lives and struggle's that most people could relate to.I did work on the LORIMAR lot, but never on Knots.  But... Thursday's at 10,I was there, on CBS.I hope older and NEW fan's support THE BEST show on the planet, by checking this out.And let's NOT wait for YEARS for season 3 and beyond!Love and LUCK to all.
summary: At LAST!!  MORE, MORE, MORE!  I love Knots Landing!

reviewText: I was glad to finally get my hands on this long awaited season of Knots Landing but i was quickly dismayed at the very poor quality of the picture and sound. I mean it's like watching and old VHS tape!I think Warner Bros should take a look at the pristine transfers of Dynasty or The Love Boat from CBS studios,they're a pleasure to watch. There's just no comparison.The show itself is quite good although dated in parts but the main actors are all topnotch, i hope more are released soon but i might be tempted to try ordering the complete series from other sources;who knows the quality of their transfers couldn't possibly get any worst?
Title: N/A

reviewText: Season Two (the first complete Knots season) is notable for two things: the arrival of Abby (hallelujah!) and the totally unexpected - at the time - Sid cliffhanger. Everything that made KL the amazing show it was starts with this season. I was so happy to hear of its release - I thought we'd be stuck with only the Season One DVD release. Now it's time to start releasing the rest of the seasons, preferably quickly (one a year/every 6-8 months?) There's obviously a demand from fans of what was by far the BEST nighttime drama of the 80's. It's so much more than just a soap opera, and kicked Dallas, Dynasty and Falcon Crest to the curb.
summary: Donna Mills arrives--what more needs to be said?

reviewText: I am watching some of the shows from the childhood just to see them from a different perspective.  For some reason, I thought I liked Knots Landing.  This season I have been bored to tears and I really don't like Karen or any of the women; they seem overbearing and too nosy.  I can't believe men would want to be around them any significant period of time.Abby was too obvious.  Shouldn't a h---o be slick?  Abby is a blazing h---o?  Why would any woman let her around her husband?I just can't believe how boring this second season is.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Knots Landing in my opinion is possibly the best series that has been on television. After much fanfare, season 1 was released, but didn't sell very well. Because of this the studio said they would not release any more seasons...THIS BROKE MY HEART!!!! After season one, Knots really took off! I never missed a single episode during Knot's entire run! For me, the show really took off around the time that Sid was in the hospital...when he died, it was like a part of my family died too!Make sure to order this one....you won't be sorry! Mid season 2 is when this show will really impress you! Donna Mills comes to Knots in season 2. From that point on, it is always fresh, always exciting, and keeps you wanting more! I grew up with these characters...laughed, cried, dreamed and hoped....MAKE SURE TO ORDER SEASON 2, YOU WILL WANT MORE!!!!!!
summary: Knots Season 2 is coming! Make sure to buy this one, so we can get more!

At this pace however it might not be in during my lifetime.People who love Knots REALLY love Knots and we want to own the entire series. reviewText: A couple of nights ago the Home Theater Forum presented Warner Brothers Home Video (T.V. and Animation divisions only) for a chat.  During the forum, Warner Brothers FINALLY said they are giving KNOTS LANDING another chance by releasing SEASON 2 sometime in 2009.  Therefore, in order for this series to have continued success, We, the fans and any other curious viewers, new viewers, etc... need to show support to buy this series. ESPECIALLY THE FIRST WEEK OF IT'S RELEASE!!! THE FIRST WEEK SALES WILL DETERMINE CONTINUED DVD SEASON SETS OF KNOTS LANDING.....Very much like a new movie, when it's released in theaters, the first week opening sales determines if a movie should/could have a sequel. (think in terms of the recent "Dark Knight" movie with Heath Ledger) which was a box office hit the first week (and beyond) when it was in theaters this summer.  The movie is also coming out with a sequel within the next 2-3 years because of this success.Therefore if you apply those terms to the first week sales of the DVD release of Knots Landing's 2nd season, it will have continued success, like it's sister show DALLAS.  Please, I know the economy has not been the greatest (and it seems to be getting worse) and soon most of us will only be able to watch t.v. at home anyway (instead of going to the movies), please save your money and support this wonderful show. PLEASE BUY THIS THE 2ND SEASON THE FIRST WEEK OF IT'S RELEASE!!! If all is successful, Warner Brothers will continue to produce the remaining seasons of this show as well as another show....FALCON CREST.....that's right, all you FALCON CREST fans out there, according to Warner Brothers chat the other night, sales of KNOTS LANDING will also help determine releasing not only more KNOTS LANDING, but FALCON CREST as well. So FALCON CREST fans.....listen up....check out Knots Landing Season 1 (now) & Season 2 (in 2009)!!!  Your show will be next up to bat if you do this.I hope this helps the fans of both shows understand how important buying your favorite show the first week its release helps determine whether or not the studios will continue releasing a series (and other series). JUST A REMINDER: click on the Amazon's wish list reminder link to let you know when KNOTS LANDING SEASON 2 is released (it's definitely coming in 2009!!).  Then when Warner makes the annoucement for the release, Amazon will let you know via email and then you can preorder your copy!!  Thanks for reading!!!P.S. For all those trivia buffs....Knots Landing Season 2 is the first season DONNA MILLS appears as ABBY, the michievious blonde bombshell who causes havoc around the cul-de-sac.
summary: KNOTS LANDING SEASON 2 IN 2009!!! BUY IT"S UP TO YOU TO KEEP THIS SERIES GOING ON DVD (Read More)

reviewText: Finally, after a three year wait Warner Brothers released "Knots Landing-The Complete Second Season" on DVD in 2009. The second year stormed onto television screens in the fall of 1980 with the arrival of beautiful Donna Mills in the role of Sid's sister Abby Cunningham. The producers wisely realized what was missing from the "Knots Landing" canvas was a good villin, so Abby arrived and shooked things up in the cul-de-sac. This casting stunt would later be replicated on ABC's "Dynasty" with the arrival of Joan Collins.Like its other seasons and unlike other primetime soaps, "Knots Landing" was far more realistic in their story-telling depicting issues that often made headlines such as rape, alcoholism, and hostage situations, the later which was used in an early season two episode where the women of "Knots Landing" were held captive by a bunch of maniacs while holding a baby shower. This particular episode is still one of my favorite "Knots Landing" shows.This four disc set includes all 18 season two episodes, but is sparce on bonuses.The season finished at #28 in the national Nielsen's with a 15.1 rating.Sadly, like season one this set of "Knots..." didn't sell very well and there are currently no plans for the studio to release future DVD's. Hopefully, Warners will release future "Knots Landing" season sets similar to the way they are releasing "Falcon Crest" which is through their own website.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Knots Landing came back in season two with the introduction of Sid Fairgate's sister Abby (Donna Mills). Abby was 14 years his junior, and he'd always been oblivious of her scheming ways, but Karen was suspicious of almost everything Abby did. When Abby took a job at Knots Landing Motors, she helped Gary out of a bind with mobsters by going to his brother J.R. Ewing (Larry Hagman). Abby went out of her way to make sure Val found out Gary was cheating on her with Judy Trent (Jane Elliott), the attractive wife of Earl Trent, a man he was sponsoring in Alcoholics Anonymous. Even though Abby set her sights on Gary, she settled for Richard, taking no great effort to conceal the affair from Laura, who took on a career in real estate and began a flirtation with her boss, Scooter Warren (Allan Miller). Abby dumped Richard when her ex-husband Jeff Cunningham (Barry Jenner) threatened to take her children away. Viewers discovered exactly how manipulative Abby could be when the women of Knots Landing held a baby shower for Ginger and were interrupted by criminals who held them hostage; Abby seduced one of the thugs, helping to save them.Season 2 is better than season 1. Most of the credit goes to Abby and the change of pace the show was taking. I absolutely love this... but where are seasons 3 through 14? This show was so popular in the 1980s, so why not have further DVD releases? I definitely think there's a fan base out there. There's fan petitions online and begging pages all over Facebook for further releases. We'd buy them, Warner Brothers, you just got to release them first. All 14 seasons of Dallas are out, they're slowly releasing Dynasty and Falcon Crest. Falcon Crest has a smaller fan base than Knots Landing, so where's our Knots? Where?
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had just about given up hope On Season 2 of Knot's Being Released but it just goes to show that if you are Persistant and constantly badgered the studios, your voice will be heard! And the Best Part is that it is the ENTIRE SECOND SEASON(not those split up seasons like many of the shows are)! Knot's Landing Didnt even get to be good until Abby(Donna Mills) came onto the scene. Every Soap Opera needs their Witch(actually thinking of another word) and Abby Fit The Bill Perfectly! Knots Landing to Me was The Best of  The 80's Night Soaps  because It's Characters were More Easy to Relate too than characters such as JR Ewing or Alexis Carrington(Loved those shows, I just dont wear diamonds and drive around in Rolls Royce's). The Knot's Landing Characters faced Problems that everyday People Faced and The Plot Lines were Never Over The Top(well, okay, maybe some Plotlines were, Val's Twins being Kidnapped, Karen Being Kidnapped, etc etc). I am glad that the Studio is giving Knots Landing a Second Chance and I hope that  the fans will support the release of this DVD so that Season 3 Will Be released! Knot's didnt even begin to get Hot Until Like its Fifth Season, so it would be a shame if the collection stopped at Season 2(future seasons featured the Great Lisa Hartman as Ciji, Julie Harris as Val's Mom and Alec Baldwin in one of his earliest Roles as Julie Harri's Crazy Son , Not To Mention William Devane, Nicolette Sheridan, Michelle Phillips, Hey we just cant Miss that)!

reviewText: Having viewed Series 2 of KNOTS LANDING on DVD, I do agree with Solomon from NSW Australia that these episodes are quite dated and mostly self contained episodes (like Season 1), however it slowly starts to feel more like a serial as Season 2 unfolds mid-way through. For example, the ongoing problems with the lawyer next door, Abby continously flirting, and the alcholic man that Garry helps.The quality of the film on the DVD is disappointing - especially when you compare it with some of the seasons of Dallas and Dynasty which have been cleaned up well for DVD.  It makes you wonder if Warner Bros really care about this series and are just bowing to pressure. Still, we should be grateful to have it at all, and perhaps the film stock was just too bad to work with.Many KNOTS LANDING fans agree that the show really took off from Season 4 onwards. This is true. The early years of the show were problematic. Donna Mills was brought on to add some spark, although the show still almost got axed. Fortunately, Donna Mills character of Abby developed and the show took on more of a serial nature like any good soap opera should be.While the show got truly better from Season 4 onwards, Warner Bros obviously have to release the early years first.  I just hope they continue to release season after season. Please don't stop Warner Bros!  If possible, could you please release them in quick succession?  I'm now ready for Season 3 and 4 ... and then the rest. I'd also like to see all the KNOTS LANDING specials released too (like 'Back to the Cul-de-sac'). ThanksDon't get me wrong, Season 2 has its moments, and there is some fine acting in there too. But its a hit and miss season. Fortunately, the fine acting from Michelle Lee and Joan Van Ark keeps the show watchable. Also the show has a more 'down to earth' feeling than Dallas or Dynasty.

reviewText: I was in high school when this series started, and I started watching after two or three seasons into the program.  These episodes are new to me, and with the addition of Abbey, they are becoming more interesting.I initially ordered Season One, and waited forever for Season Two to be released.  Season Two was quickly devoured, and now I am impatiently awaiting the others.  They really need to step up production.  I was annoyed that the quality of the video was down-graded from Season One.  The video was not DVD standard, more like video transferred to DVD, and no commentary from Val and Gary, like Season One.

reviewText: Warner Brothers waited so long to release season two because the sales of the season one DVD were, in their words, "quite disappointing."Because of fan badgering, they finally decided to try releasing season two.If day-of-release sales for season two are poor, I suspect Satan will be skating before we see season three.
summary: If you want to see future seasons, you MUST preorder this one.
